channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024040575
item.description:
Report E-2024040575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: NELSONVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABC Supply Co
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABC Supply contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred at a job site located at 55 Washington St. in Nelsonville, OH. The spill consists of approximately 25 gallons of Mule Hide Low VOC Bonding Agent, which released from 5-5-gallon metal drums, due to the drums not being strapped in properly and falling over during unloading. The asphalt around the job site has been affected, no drains or waterways.

item.title: Report E-2024040573
item.description:
Report E-2024040573

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 12, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN2735 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel overpacked the damaged jug in one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted site. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040588
item.description:
Report E-2024040588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon release of UN1210 "ProÂ® Varnish" arrived damaged at Terminal XCN. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was shipped without the lid being secured resulting in one gallon of material impacting the drum and Trailer #317-2767. The release dried up/evaporated during transit, no waste was generated. ERTS and the caller reviewed the safety data sheet and the caller advised that the terminal personnel would be securing the lid to the drum and would be returning the freight to the shipper. Transport was managed by the terminal.

item.title: Report X-2024041135
item.description:
Report X-2024041135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO RESPOND TO A FLAMMABLE LEAKER. UPON ARRIVAL TO THE SPILL LOCATION PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE FLOOR. USING THE DECISION TREE, FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE AND RELATED SPILL DEBRIS WERE CONTAINERIZED IN A LINED SPILL-TRAY AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024041168
item.description:
Report X-2024041168

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THERE WAS A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE BELT. RESPONDER PUT ON FULL PPE AND RESPONDED. THE BOX WAS WET ON ONE SIDE. OPENED IT UP AND IT WAS AEROSOL CANS WITH THE LIDS BUSTED AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT. NOTICED THERE WAS NO MARKINGS ON OUTSIDE OF PACKAGE SO RESPONDER CALLED THE HAZMAT HOTLINE TO SEE IF THIS WAS UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2024041156
item.description:
Report X-2024041156

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDERWAS CALLED TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING PACKAGE AT DOOR 99. SUPERVISOR SAID PACKAGE WAS NOT LEAKING BUT HAD A STRONG SMELL. NO OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE, THE BOX WAS WRAPPED IN BLACK PLASTIC. TOOK PACKAGE BACK TO PSC CAGE, DISCOVERED IT WAS LEAKING AND INNER BOX HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DESIGNATION ON IT. METAL CANS INSIDE BOX WERE DENTED AND CRUSHED. RESPONDER DISCOVERED UNDECLARED WHEN SDS FOR THE SHIPMENT SHOWS IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN SHIPPED AS A HAZARD CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID AS PER DOT CLASSIFICATION. SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS AND DISPOSED OF VIA DMP PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2024041182
item.description:
Report X-2024041182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the CLER facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four one gallon cans and two one quart cans packaged inside of a plastic bag. One of the quart cans was dented causing the lid to open and spill the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a new declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024040473
item.description:
Report E-2024040473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN3149 was damaged and released approximately 0.063 gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. A neutralizing agent was deployed to the impacted surfaces and absorbent pads/cleaners were used to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. The one (1) damaged 1-gallon pail was patched and overpacked into one (1) 35-gallon vented drum. All UN3149-impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) additional 35-gallon vented drums for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2024040469
item.description:
Report E-2024040469

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a half gallon spill of UN1263, MC-Ferrox A100 from a gallon metal pail. The spill was caused by an accident when terminal personnel dropped the can while off loading cargo. The spill was contained to the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill with oil dri and containerizing solid waste into a 5-gallon DF. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040807
item.description:
Report X-2024040807

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS VENTED WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED RIGHT SIDE UP TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE
